title.rendered: RBI, CCIL urge Japan to drop inspection clause

content.rendered:
The tussle between Indian financial market regulators and their peers in developed countries over ‘extra-territorial jurisdictions’ is playing out on multiple fronts, leaving a dozen MNC banks trying to figure out the way forward.

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and Clearing Corporation of India (CCIL) Ltd, which settles large volumes of trades on bonds, derivatives and foreign exchange, are trying to break the logjam with Bank of Japan (BoJ) and Financial Services Agency, Japan (JFSA) ..

Source : https://tinyurl.com/4dmdme23
